channel.title: I seem to be a bit confused
channel.description:
I've been looking through the source codes of different Private Servers, but I can't seem to make sense out of a few things.
One of them is how the colon codes work. I'm yet to find anything in there that defines the actions of the various colon commands.
Another thing is why it has both the Java files and the CLASS files? Is this just so we can learn what's going on when, by reading the Java files?
One more question,
How much Java would a person need to learn to make his or her own private server? A good amount, or is it mostly just cutting and pasting different lines of code?
Please write back!
-Mike

item.title: I seem to be a bit confused
item.dc:creator: @jason2gs jason2gs
item.description:
@jason2gs wrote:

The colon codes. Where you type like- ::help to get a list of the commands and such that people make up. Where does the maker of the server define what each code does? Like in one server, if you type in “::fish” it takes you to the fountain in varrock (the small one) to fish that

I know what CLASS files are, and I know you need them to make a Java applet work right, but why does the source to the private servers have both Java files and CLASS files?

On the last; what would a Level 4 tutorial be? What site do you base it off of? (Each site’s gotta be different, right?)

Read full topic
item.source: I seem to be a bit confused

item.title: I seem to be a bit confused
item.dc:creator: @Zaron Zaron
item.description:
@Zaron wrote:

ok, first, idk what you mean on your 1st question, but the second is, the class files usually run the server right, and last, you dont need that much knowlege, you just need to be able to do at leaste a lvl4 tutorial good and you can do a server really good

Read full topic
